segment.source: Description: The first step in submitting an IAP (in-app product) in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: Description: The first step in submitting an IAP (in-app product) in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: title: Set your IAP product ID
segment.target: title: Set your IAP product ID

segment.source: The first step in submitting an IAP (in-app product) in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: The first step in submitting an IAP (in-app product) in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: This is the same identifier that you will need to reference in your app's code to call the IAP.
segment.target: This is the same identifier that you will need to reference in your app's code to call the IAP.

segment.source: An IAP must be associated with an app that you've created in the dashboard already (even if you haven't submitted it yet).
segment.target: An IAP must be associated with an app that you've created in the dashboard already (even if you haven't submitted it yet).

segment.source: You can find the button to Create a new IAP on either your app's Overview page or its IAPs page.
segment.target: You can find the button to Create a new IAP on either your app's Overview page or its IAPs page.

segment.source: Once you've clicked the button, you'll see the Create IAP page.
segment.target: Once you've clicked the button, you'll see the Create IAP page.

segment.source: Here, you'll type in the unique product ID that you'll use to refer to the offer in your code.
segment.target: Here, you'll type in the unique product ID that you'll use to refer to the offer in your code.

segment.source: Here are a few things to keep in mind when choosing a product ID:
segment.target: Here are a few things to keep in mind when choosing a product ID:

segment.source: Customers won't see this product ID.
segment.target: Customers won't see this product ID.

segment.source: (Later, you can enter a title and description to be displayed to customers.)
segment.target: (Later, you can enter a title and description to be displayed to customers.)

segment.source: You can’t change or delete an IAP's product ID after it's been published.
segment.target: You can’t change or delete an IAP's product ID after it's been published.

segment.source: A product ID can't be more than 100 characters in length.
segment.target: A product ID can't be more than 100 characters in length.

segment.source: A product ID cannot include any of the following characters: < > \* % & : \\ ? + ,
segment.target: A product ID cannot include any of the following characters: < > \* % & : \\ ? + ,

segment.source: To offer your IAP on all devices, you must only use alphanumeric characters, periods, and/or underscores.
segment.target: To offer your IAP on all devices, you must only use alphanumeric characters, periods, and/or underscores.

segment.source: If you use any other types of characters, the IAP will not be available for purchase to customers running Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier.
segment.target: If you use any other types of characters, the IAP will not be available for purchase to customers running Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier.

segment.source: A product ID doesn't have to be unique within the Windows Store, but it must be unique to your developer account.
segment.target: A product ID doesn't have to be unique within the Windows Store, but it must be unique to your developer account.
